oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: The names of those who are dead must not be uttered by the children at night. (L VIII.
26. 8310 8312). According to |han kass'o's grandfather (Tsatsi), when people die they become spirit
people. If the names of the dead (the old people) are called as if they are still alive, they will come and harm the living.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Life after death
